summary: This is a service request log from August 15, 2019, detailing the installation and upgrade of a Nice Vision surveillance system at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York. It indicates work was performed from August 12-16, 2019, and notes that approximately 20 cameras were out of service during the installation.

events.title: Surveillance System Installation Begins
events.description: Installation of a new Nice Vision surveillance system begins at the FBOP MCC New York facility.

events.title: Service Request for System Upgrade
events.description: A service request is logged for the ongoing installation, noting approximately 20 cameras are out and programming needs to be finished.

events.title: Scheduled Training for Comm Tech
events.description: Training for Comm Tech is scheduled on phase 1 of the surveillance system installation.

locations: FBOP MCC New York M50109 (130164.001) Main Location NEW YORK, NY 10007
FBOP MCC New York MS0109 (130104.001) NEW YORK, NY 10007
keyFacts: A surveillance system upgrade was being performed at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York in August 2019.
The work involved installing 4 SVRs, 1 decoder, and 12 NVE2016 encoders, with approximately 110 of 161 cameras named correctly at the time of the log.
Approximately 20 cameras were reported as 'out' during the installation process.
The service was requested as an emergency, and the problem was affecting all users.
The document references 'FBOP MCC New York', indicating the Federal Bureau of Prisons Metropolitan Correctional Center.
